title.value: Virtual Reality for Pediatric Trauma Education - A Preliminary Face and Content Validation Study
title.justification: The title is specified clearly at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Virtual Reality for Pediatric Trauma Education - A Preliminary Face and Content Validation Study

extractions.description: The paper evaluates the face and content validity of a virtual reality (VR) software designed for pediatric trauma education. It focuses on the use of VR to enhance trauma skills and decrease education costs. The study involved multiple physicians testing the software and found it valuable, especially for non-technical skills training. While the VR was seen as realistic and effective, some users experienced discomfort during the simulation.

type.justification: The study involves practical testing and validation of VR software by physicians, and collects data through surveys, making it an empirical study.
type.quote: This preliminary validation study evaluates the face and content validity of a VR software designed to enhance pediatric trauma skills.
